...in theory.

 In practice, WCS skins have counted as a champion's skin in the priority queue. (see SSW Talon for the most egregious example).
To be fair, that is a legacy skin. Plus that came out nearly 2 years ago anyway, so it has been a while since she got one.

Hiya! 

We don't announce if a champion is getting a skin or not in advance because we swap things around internally, and sometimes, a skin just doesn't work out. Like, you'd be pretty bummed out  if I said there was a new Janna skin coming out, and it's going to be Surprise Party themed, then the idea just doesn't work, so we scrap it. D:

Does the skins team ever sit down and think "We *need* to make a skin for so-and-so," then just keep iterating on designs until one works? Or is it typically "here's a theme, and here are the champions that come to mind first for this theme"?

Generally, we work on themes. As you've seen this year, most patches have a group of skins as a thematic, as opposed to just one offs. It's more fun to play as a group who has the game skins - like PROJECT or Pool Party! 

But yes, we do have ideations for a particular champion. We did something like that with Fizz, for example. We got in a room and tossed out ideas for what a new Fizz skin would look like. Fun fact, Cottontail Fizz was Riot LoveStrut's shower thought. :P

THINK ABOUT NEXT YEAR'S APRIL FOOLS SKIN

DUCKMASTER SWAIN
Or definitely not beatrice.

Yorick was never on the skin list because they realized too little, too late how monstrously bad he was in terms of kit design. Over the years they've said he's been in and out and in and out of the rework team's work load because they said they never have been able to preserve his playstyle and modernize him. This is why it took having the dedicated relaunch teams that worked on Sion/Poppy available before they were finally able to make progress on pushing him through. The fact that he's been publicly announced and plunked on the Update schedule page means he's very very far in development, if not nearing completion.
